method.name: Statistical two Normal samples variance comparation F test

reference.ref: Snedecor, G. W., Cochran, W. G.: Statistical Methods. Iowa State University Press, Ames, IA. (1989)

generalDescription.type: Statistical two sample means comparation using the F test by mean of Stat-Regr-SnedecorF algorithm.
generalDescription.objective: Execution of StatTestModF test for comparing two regression methods performance.
generalDescription.howWork: Stat-Regr-SnedecorF is a method for comparing the performance of two regression algorithms using statistics techniques. It can be used in k-folds and 5x2 cross validation training experiments. Stat-Regr-SnedecorF is associated to the training and testing results of the two models in an experiment that are to be compared. Once those models has been trained and tested, the Stat-Regr-SnedecorF takes place. The process calculates the mean cuadratic error for each partitions results. The statistical sample includes all of those error measures for each method to be compared. Then the F-Test is executed with the Null hypothesis as true if both methods have equals variance.

parameterSpec.param: signlevel: a value in the range (0,1). Default value: 0.95. The significance level represents the probability of erroneous rejecting the NULL Hypothesis.

method.example:
Problem type: Regression Methods to compare: Regr-LinearLMS vs Regr-PolQuadraticLMS Dataset: machine-cpu Type of partitions: k-fold, k=10
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the ./results/Stat-Regr-SnedecorF/TSTRegr-LinearLMSvsRegr-PolQuadraticLMS/ folder the results0s0.stat file:
F test, Modeling Mean cuadratic error in each fold: Algorithm = 0 Fold 0 : 6269.340047889225 Fold 1 : 2147.2024593503747 Fold 2 : 1995.8867100647303 Fold 3 : 8429.461050092124 Fold 4 : 3752.8946186462886 Fold 5 : 1265.75194457092 Fold 6 : 1378.2443444675362 Fold 7 : 10369.871521593977 Fold 8 : 13447.477062000205 Fold 9 : 3784.308766572497 Algorithm = 1 Fold 0 : 19883.17406264338 Fold 1 : 923.086212825497 Fold 2 : 1782.6768777295042 Fold 3 : 40347.29384309221 Fold 4 : 2902.9903279394525 Fold 5 : 1706.9056645604135 Fold 6 : 445.70708214385405 Fold 7 : 4560.977759698817 Fold 8 : 5227.39838633173 Fold 9 : 1143.2328230123044 Null hypothesis, equal variances Output=0: There is evidence against H0 p-value: 0.0029132565237861563
